pageTitle: DailyMed - TRAZODONE HYDROCHLORIDE- trazodone hydrochloride tablet
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {118342=• Abnormal Bleeding: May increase the risk of bleeding. Use with NSAIDs, aspirin, or other drugs that affect coagulation may compound this risk (5.7, 7)., 112044=Revised: 6/2014, 7218=Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088., 116677=• Discontinuation Symptoms: May occur with abrupt discontinuation and include anxiety and sleep disturbance. Upon discontinuation, taper trazodone hydrochloride tablets and monitor for symptoms (5.13)., 114559=• CYP3A4 Inducers (e.g., Carbamazepine): May necessitate higher dose of trazodone hydrochloride tablets (7)., 121576=• Starting dose: 150 mg in divided doses daily. May be increased by 50 mg per day every three to four days. Maximum dose: 400 mg per day in divided doses (2)., 19863=Rev. E 5/2014, 115363=or FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch, 114760=• CYP3A4 Inhibitors: May necessitate lower dose of trazodone hydrochloride tablets (7)., 4928=Rev. B. 5/2014, 122558=Warnings and Precautions (5.12) 06/2014, 5727=For more information, call 1-888-838-2872., 28467=50 mg: White, round, compressed tablet, debossed “PLIVA 433” on one side and scored on the other side. Available in bottles of 100, 500 and 1000., 28302=100 mg: White, round, compressed tablet, debossed “PLIVA 434” on one side and scored on the other side. Available in bottles of 100, 500 and 1000 Tablets.}
